poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Breakfast is the best meal Sunday breakfast after mass The full cholesterol deal. The extended Family, at least three of them Stricken with angina (Never saw the inside of a pub). My personal best is three: at the hotel, In flight and then home. Don't clear away The breadboard and the jampots; never know, My paints and palette, as Renoir might have said If you don't need to paint like you need Your breakfast, then don't.
